question: 0a. B6L Mayo Sleep Questionnaire — Participant - Form date
0b. B6L Mayo Sleep Questionnaire — Participant - Examiner's initials
0c. B6L Mayo Sleep Questionnaire — Participant - Submitted?
0c1. If 'B6L Mayo Sleep Questionnaire — Participant' not submitted, specify reason
response_labels: 95, Physical problem|96, Cognitive/behavioral problem|97, Other|98, Verbal refusal|99, Unknown or inadequate information

question: 0. Is the participant too cognitively impaired (e.g., CDR>1) to complete this form?
1. Have you ever been told that you seem to “act out your dreams” while sleeping (punched or flailed arms in the air, shouted or screamed)?
1a1. How many months or years has this been going on? (years)
1a2. How many months or years has this been going on? (months)
1b. Have you ever been injured from these behaviors (bruises, cuts, broken bones)?
1c. Has a bedpartner ever been injured from these behaviors (bruises, blows, pulled hair)?
1d. Have you had dreams of being chased or attacked, or that involve defending yourself?
1e. Have you been told that you make movements while sleeping that seem to match the details of your dream?
2. Have you been told that your legs repeatedly jerk or twitch during sleep (not just when falling asleep)?
3. Does a restless, nervous, tingly, or creepy-crawly feeling in your legs make it hard to fall or stay asleep?
3a. Do you experience an irresistible urge to move the legs at those times?
3b. Do the uncomfortable leg sensations decrease when you move them or when you walk around?
3c. When do these sensations seem to be worse?
4. Have you ever walked around the bedroom or house in your sleep?
5. Have you ever snorted or choked yourself awake?
6. Have you ever been told that you stop breathing in your sleep?
6a. Are you currently being treated for this (e.g., CPAP)?
7. Do you experience leg cramps at night (e.g., also called a “charlie horse” with intense pain in cer-tain muscles in the leg)?
8. Rate your general level of alertness for the past 3 weeks on a scale from 0 to 10:
response_labels: 0 – 10; 0 = Sleep all day, 10 = Fully and normally awake
